intro: Hieracium umbrophilum, commonly known as the shadowy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to woodland and shaded areas of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. Its flowers are yellow and appear in late spring to early summer, producing small seeds that are dispersed by wind. Hieracium umbrophilum prefers moist, nutrient-rich soils and is often found in forest understories where light is limited.
